result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean Michael Roland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Unpaid Court obligations.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Complete all conditions imposed by Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean Michael Roland

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:01 Defendant Sean Michael Roland in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Sean Michael Roland in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Froelich and Nelson have both reviewed the revocation summar. Froelich: gives  sentencing argument and agrees with 3 month jail as recommended by the DOC. Atty Nelson gives sentencing argument and requests time served. Agrees to 34 days credit. Defendant addresses the court. Court; orders 60 days jail with 34 days jail., credit for good time. Release: June 5, 2017. Civil judgment for unpaid court obligations.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
from Probation and Parole Agent Charysse Minder re: recommend 90 days incarceration
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

1:30 Defendant Sean Michael Roland in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich - Def will plead to charge in the amended complaint which will be filed today. Amend to Disorderly Conduct in a private place abusive.  1 yr probation with 2 days conditional jail time.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to the charge in the amended complaint Disorderly Conduct misdemeanor.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the charge in the amended complaint  Disorderly Conduct. Court orders S/W Probation 1 year. Conditions Court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Complete any conditions set by agent.
Final pre-trial on December 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Final pre-trial on December 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on January 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.
and Victim's Petition for Bond Modification.

Final pre-trial on November 8, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Jury trial on December 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

04:06 Defendant Sean Michael Roland in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson. Sean E. Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson requests bond hearing to lift no contact order.  Froelich objects to lifting no contact order and has continuing concerns with victim's safety. Court calls Ms. Karlstad to the stand.  Ms. Karlstad is sworn in. Court examines Ms. Karlstad. Ms. Karlstad provides testimony. Froelich x-exams Ms. Karlstad. Atty Nelson x-exam Ms. Karlstad.  Court grants Atty Nelson's request to modify bond. Froelich requests random drug testing.  Atty Nelson: defendant already has drug tests in place through human services. Court orders random drug testing through law enforcement, refused or failed tests will result in original bond with no contact provision being put back in place, Attorney's to provide 48 hours notice if that change is to occur. 04:21
from V.W.C Erin Mulhollam re: alleged victim is requesting Petition for Bond Modification be addressed today.
Pre-trial conference on September 1, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Bond conditions read to the Defendant by the Court Commissioner.
Address: correct
DOB: correct
Phone: defendant needs to notify the court within 48 hours of phone number

03:50 Defendant Sean Michael Roland in court, in custody VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ. Attorney Liesl Nelson appears via phone for the defendant.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint.   Court reads charges and possible penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Defendant pleads not guilty.  Court rec/enters.  O'Sullivan requests $200 cash bond and no contact.  Atty Nelson objects to cash bond. Court orders $2000 signature bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
